title: Red tape and cautious investors are generating colossal risks for us all
text:
How risky is it to lend your money to a big tobacco company for 30 years? According to the markets, it’s about as safe as lending to the UK government was three years ago. Buyers of a British American Tobacco bond issued in 2016 and maturing in 2052 receive interest payments of just 2.25pc a year, the same as the yield on 30-year gilts before the Brexit vote. In other words, the market thinks BAT is a very, very safe bet.
